newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Lukoil announces start of share swap.
newsitem.headline: Lukoil announces start of share swap.

text.p: Russia's biggest oil company LUKoil said on Tuesday that shares in its subsidiaries will be swapped for a unified share in the parent company starting in two weeks.

An announcement by OAO Neftyanaya Kompaniya LUKoil published in the business newspaper Kommersant Daily said a new issue of 19.8 million ordinary shares and 12.2 million preferred shares would be exchanged for shares in LUKoil subsidiaries, without placing them on the market.
The volume of ordinary shares is valued at 495 million roubles, and preferred shares are worth 305 million roubles, the report said.
The exchange terms, set at a shareholders' meeting on June 5, 1996, are as follows:
one LUKoil-Permneft share for five LUKoil shares
five LUKoil-Nizhnevolzhskneft shares for seven LUKoil shares
one LUKoil-Astrakhanneft share for two LUKoil shares
three LUKoil-Kaliningradmorneft shares for one LUKoil share
10 LUKoil-Astrakhannefteprodukt shares for one LUKoil share.
